plot: In a future society, everyone must undergo an operation at age 19 to become beautiful and conform to society. Since her father killed himself after his surgery, 18-year-old Marilyn Cubberle desperately wants to hold on to her identity.

As Marilyn Cuberle approaches her 19th birthday she faces a momentous decision: Like everyone else in this futuristic society, she must choose which look she will adopt in the transformation process. Here, all men and women look like one of a series of approved faces, all beautiful or handsome. Marilyn doesn't want to change her appearance and is happy to look different from anyone else. Everyone assures her that she is under no obligation to undergo the transformation--but they go out of their way to make it difficult for her to say no.—garykmcd

In a future society, people on the age of nineteen need to be transformed into a beautiful model to be chosen by themselves. The eighteen years old Marilyn Cuberle does not want to be transformed despite the wishes of her mother Lana. Her best friend Valerie dos not understand her since she was submitted to the transformation. When Marilyn has a discussion with her doctor, she is sent to be interviewed by a psychiatrist. Marilyn is cult and knows every banned writers, but the doctors apparently do not accept her arguments.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
